title: Understanding $$f(x-a)$$
text: For some value a, $$f(x-a)$$ means that f(x) is translated to the right by a units. Similarly, $$f{\left(x+a\right)}$$ means that f(x) is translated to the left by a units.
speech: For some value a,  f of, parentheses x minus a,   means that f(x) is translated to the right by a units. Similarly, , f of, parentheses x plus a,   means that f(x) is translated to the left by a units.

title: Understanding $$f(x-a)$$
text: Since a is $$4$$, $$h(x-3)$$ means that the graph is translated right by $$3$$.

title: Understanding $$f{\left(x\right)}+a$$
text: For some value a, $$f{\left(x\right)}+a$$ means that f(x) is translated up by a units. Similarly, $$f(x)-a$$ means that f(x) is translated down by a units.
speech: For some value a,  f of x plus a  means that f(x) is translated up by a units. Similarly,  f of x, minus a  means that f(x) is translated down by a units.
pacedSpeech: For some value a,   f of x plus a
means that f(x) is translated up by a units. Similarly,   f of x, minus a
means that f(x) is translated down by a units.

title: Understanding $$f{\left(x\right)}+a$$
text: Since a is $$1$$, $$h{\left(x-3\right)}+1$$ means that the graph is translated up by $$1$$.
speech: Since a is  1 , , h of, parentheses x minus 3,  plus 1  means that the graph is translated up by  1 .
pacedSpeech: means that the graph is translated up by   1
